user_device_rel: 1 person to n devices; n people to m devices
device_models: Samsung PixelSense; HTC HD 7; iPhone 5; Microvision PicoP laster projector
evaluation: User study (qualitative); Quality measurements (e.g., accuracy of tracking)
contribution_desc: This paper presents the prototype of a mobile projector device (smartphone) to enable multi-user touch interaction and collaboration on surfaces. The device consists of a private display and a public projection. It enables ad hoc spatial configurations of mobile devices and projection spaces, as well as interaction techniques for supporting cross-device user interface distribution and data transfer. The paper also discusses the technical requirements and challenges in building such device.
tracking_accuracy: 93% touch recognized; ~85% touch and ~70% intensity accurate within 4 cm radius target; 89% left, 90% right, 43% up, 81% down, and 82% circle gesture recognized
tracking_characteristic: Tracking users only; Finger; Touch; Gesture; Outside-in tracking
tracking_reliability: touch position could under- and over-shoot
